content:
@Pavel Kalian @Dave Register

I seems like master does not build on some Linux builds. We need to sort this out before proceeding and landing other PRs, right?

Returning to keyboard later this evening CET
At first sight seems Dave's last commits don't guard against wx3.2 code being built on wx3.0 targets.
Do we build any wx3.0 targets at all these days?
We certainly do, "Ubuntu Latest" in GA is 22.04.

Perhaps we should reconsider this. As for the 5.10 release we used a backported wx3.2 build and thus wx3.2 plugins. After installing on jammy from the opencpn/opencpn ppa:

al@jammy:~$ ldd /usr/bin/opencpn | grep wx
    libwx_gtk3u_gl-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_gl-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741f411000)
    libwx_baseu_net-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_baseu_net-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741e5d8000)
    libwx_baseu_xml-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_baseu_xml-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741f3fd000)
    libwx_gtk3u_html-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_html-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741e509000)
    libwx_gtk3u_aui-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_aui-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741e464000)
    libwx_gtk3u_core-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_core-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741dc00000)
    libwx_baseu-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_baseu-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741d800000)
    libwx_gtk3u_richtext-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_richtext-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741d400000)
    libwx_gtk3u_webview-3.2.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwx_gtk3u_webview-3.2.so.0 (0x000073741dbd2000)
